info.readme: This is Overflow, a free site template designed by n33 (twitter.com/n33) for HTML5 UP (html5up.com) and implemented as an Umbraco Starter Kit to provide you with a site that holds basic content pages, a gallery and a contact form.

umbHomePage.bannerHeader: This is some text that needs to pop
umbHomePage.bannerText:
It will lead to a call-to-action.

Just click the button...
umbHomePage.bannerLinkText: You know you want to click me
umbHomePage.byline: A responsive starter kit for Umbraco

umbFeature.featureText: This feature block allows you to showcase one of the most important things that you want to bring to your visitors' attention.
This feature block allows you to showcase the second most important thing that you want to bring to your visitors' attention.

umbTextPage.title: Totally freeform
umbTextPage.subTitle: Nothing to see here.

umbContact.title: Get in touch
umbContact.subTitle: We're happy to talk to you about your wishes for your next project.

GenericProperty.Name: Mail To Address
GenericProperty.Description: When someone fills out the contact form, where should their e-mail be sent?

Template.Name: Overflow
Template.Design:
@inherits UmbracoTemplatePage @{ Layout = null; } @Umbraco.Field("pageName") | @Umbraco.Field("siteName", recursive: true)

@Umbraco.Field("siteName", recursive: true)

@Umbraco.Field("byline", recursive: true)

@Umbraco.Field("continueButtonText")
@{ Html.RenderPartial("umbBanner"); } @* The template is a single page website, but we still want to be able to add block of content in a variable way in there. This is being done by adding children under the homepage and looping through them and then rendering them with a specific partial view. In this foreach loop we dynamically find the appropriate parial based on the alias of the document type for the child. So if the child node has a document type with the alias "umbTextPage", we would Render the partial "umbTextPage" for that child node. This way we can easily add multiple "umbTextPage" children, or multiple "umbFeature" children, and so on. *@ @foreach (var child in Model.Content.Children) { Html.RenderPartial(child.DocumentTypeAlias, child); }
@{ Html.RenderPartial("umbSocial"); }
  • © @DateTime.Now.Year @Umbraco.Field("copyright", recursive: true).
  • Design & template: HTML5 UP
